intro: Phacelia altotonga, commonly known as the Sierra phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phacelia altotonga is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
